name: The Life of a Fuzzy Elf Quiz | Marvel Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Wagner's father is the demon D'Spayre.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Wagner's father is the demon Azazel, not D'Spayre. His mother is the devious mutant Mystique. After being abandoned, he was taken in by the wise Margali Szardos.

questions.text: Despite his demonic appearance, Wagner is a devout member of which religion?
questions.explanation:
Catholicism.

	Wagner was one time tricked into believing he had been made a Catholic priest, but this was an illusion by one of the X-Men's many villains.

questions.text: During the Morlock Massacre, Wagner drained his energy to defeat Vertigo, but was then beaten by which villain?
questions.explanation:
Riptide.

	Wagner was dealing with an incredible amount of self-doubt at the time, and the use of his powers left him amazingly weak and prone to attack.

questions.text: Wagner led this England-based team that consisted of Meggan, Colossus, Shadowcat and Wolfsbane, among others.
questions.explanation:
Excalibur.

	Excalibur was based in Britain and also included the mutant Pete Wisdom and the super-strong Captain Britain. After the series was cancelled, a new team was formed, which included the X-Men's longtime villain the Juggernaut!

questions.text: Wagner unknowingly entered into a relationship with his foster sister. What alias was she living under at the time?
questions.explanation:
Amanda Sefton.

	Amanda Sefton was really Jimaine Szardos, daughter of Margali Szardos, the woman who raised the abandoned Wagner. A magic user, she became an ally of the X-Men using the name Daytripper. She later became the second person to be called Magik.

questions.text: Nocturne is Wagner's daughter from an alternate timeline. Her mother is the Scarlet Witch.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Nocturne is really Talia Josephine Wagner, and she can possess other people, as well as fire her mother's hex bolts! With blue skin like her father, Nocturne is sure to stand out in a crowd.

questions.text: How many fingers, not including the thumb, does Wagner have on each hand?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	This is just one of the many characteristics that set Wagner apart from normal-looking mutants. He also has yellow eyes, dark blue fur and a prehensile tail.

questions.text: Wagner gets along with his teammate Wolverine. Why?
questions.explanation:
They both love beer.

	Wolverine is one of the most famous X-Men. Born James Howlett, he adopted the alias Logan and was experimented upon by the Weapon X program. A fierce fighter, his memories are jumbled and somewhat unreliable.

questions.text: What scent is left behind when Wagner teleports?
questions.explanation:
Brimstone.

	Brimstone is also known as sulfur, a crystalline and yellow solid in its original form. It is commonly used in gunpowder and fireworks.

questions.text: Contrary to his main timeline counterpart, the Nightcrawler from the Age of Apocalypse timeline hates churches.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Due to an unexplained traumatic experience, the Nightcrawler from the Age of Apocalypse timeline hates churches. He also carries two swords with him at all times, which shows his expertise as a swordsman.
